messages.message:
Hey, I'd like a list of marketplace apps that are available on the docs page (or somewhere else) if possible. I currently share a spreadsheet which I have to keep up to date, and for RFIs I don't have somewhere I can point towards with a list

cc @jean
@jean We do have the list of all the details that are required for documenting the Marketplace apps on our official documentation. Please let us know who can help us with review and publish tasks.
The apps can be viewed on aihub at any time - without logging in.  Any reason that wouldn’t work for your contacts as another option? But i agree it’d be nice to have them listed in docs somewhere.

I’m not necessarily opposed to this, but I have two concerns.

1. Maintenance: these kinds of lists can fall out of true pretty quickly. I’m happy to take information and updates from Hamish, but it’s one more thing for someone to update and there’s already a lot of moving parts around here. It’s just so easy for the list to become wrong and then, blammo! The docs are wrong.
2. Isn’t this redundant with the apps page? Something that would be very easy for my (tightly strapped) team would be to add a card from the Docs landing page to the all apps page, just promoting the marketplace. That seems more direct and maintainable to me. Is there any reason a list in the docs is _better_ than a link to the marketplace itself?

Ah cool I didn't realise this was possible without having an account. In that case lets put the link in the docs somewhere and we should also explain why these marketplace apps are useful and that they can be customised/combined with other? https://aihub.instabase.com/hub
Yeah, for sure! I’ll add a little card with some context right on the landing page; it’s our highest traffic page.

Agree with Hamish here. If not the whole list, we should at least mention about Marketplace apps, their usage, and the "Customize" app feature in our documentation. @jean please let us know if you need any details related to this topic. Happy to help. :slightly_smiling_face:
@Anshu can you "combine" marketplace apps? E.g. I want a home lending app, so I take the Passport, Bank Statement and Payslip apps and put everything in a single project?

No we cant do that right now. I found one related ticket (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-2100) where the ask is to combine the schema of multiple classes/apps. @Kaustubh (KD) Any latest thoughts here?

@Hamish this is just a missing capability. We've thought about it and know its a need. Just resourcing. Glad to pick it up a quick spec and get us aligned on the approach (though I don't think this will be a complex user journey)

CC: @rachel.datlowe @lauren.lane @aristo as it relates to our planned webinar hot topic: AI Hub marketplace/hub apps (and what we talked about similar to Hamish' remark: `In that case lets put the link in the docs somewhere and we should also explain why these marketplace apps are useful` )
